text: The Nuln Ironsides are selected from the guards and apprentices of the renowned Imperial Gunnery School. They are among the most respected and well-equipped musketeer regiments in the Empire.
The musketeers patrolling the walls of the volcano are known as Bronzeballs, named after the metal used to craft their bulletsâ€”though they don't usually use them.

The Sterntower Marksmen are a newly formed regiment from Stangart. They are part of the garrison that watches over the signal towers and outposts in the shadow of the mighty Black Mountains in Eastern Wissenland.

The Seahawks are one of the most famous regiments of Nordland, composed of over twenty companies. They are often the first regiment sent to support other provinces, receiving better equipment and higher pay than other units.
The Honorary Company of Altdorf, also known as the Sons of the Reik, is a Reikland regiment that is well-trained and well-equipped, dedicated to serving the Emperor and Altdorf.

Originally known as the "Swords of the Sun", these swordsmen are refugees from the fall of Talabecland. They, along with other similar companies, are dedicated to avenging those who took their homes, families, and hope.
The halberdiers known as "Death's Heads" were formed during the Vampire Wars. They originated from the small town of Essen in Ostermark during Vlad von Carstein's reign.
The true griffon knights, only the best of the best demigryph knights can ride on the true griffon.
Priests guarding the Grand Cathedral of Sigmar, using the lightning to protect the Sigmarite church.
Priests guarding the Grand Cathedral of Sigmar, using spears enchanted with lightning to pierce their enemies.
The inner sanctum guards of the Grand Cathedral of Sigmar, capable of wielding the Thunder Hammer to destroy all evil.
Using specialized crossbows to shoot thunderous bolts, summoning a natural hawk to assist when necessary.
Followers of Taal summon magical warhawks to assist in battle.
Demigryph knights on patrol wielding dual pistols, capable of attacking enemies from a distance.
Wielding massive longswords, they cut down all enemies around them.
Warriors from Nordland whose abilities surpass those of most ordinary men.
Dark Judges keep no secrets and only appear on battlefields against Chaos and heretics.
The Reiksguard, clad in heavy armor, charge into the fray and fight fiercely amidst the chaos of battle.
Part of the Knights of the White Wolf, a knightly order devoted to Ulric, wielding dual hammers.
A splinter group of the Knights of Morr, formed due to ideological differences with the main order.
A regiment of witch hunters within the Empire, specialized in hunting heretics. They are scattered across the Empire and only gather when needed.
Among the stubborn people of Ostland, they follow a warrior named Volgan and use flame weapons to ruthlessly destroy approaching enemies.
